a.title: Last Day of School for Students - Grade Cards Sent Home

span.style: font-family: Calibri, Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: 16px;
background-color: initial; text-align: inherit; font-size: 12pt; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif; color: rgb(32, 32, 32);

p.span: Please continue to be cautious and follow the directives and recommendation of our healthcare leaders.
All reports show that we are flattening the curve of infection in Ohio.
The only way that will continue, according to the experts, is follow what we have been told to do and not get too comfortable too quickly.
Please stay safe, maintain Social Distancing protocol, and the follow the Governor’s Stay-at-Home order.

If we find that the school closure goes beyond the month of May, the following dates have been selected to proceed with Senior activities. We want to give families time to plan and make the necessary arrangements. We also understand that any future developments may cause us to alter our plans, but at this time, we are planning this very important Senior Weekend.

div.p: · Thursday, July 16th -- Senior Graduation Breakfast and Graduation Practice, beginning at 10:00a.m. in the BHS Main Gym.
· Friday, July 17th -- Local Scholarship Night and Dessert at 6 pm BHS Cafeteria
· Saturday, July 18th -- Prom/Afterprom at 8 pm. Stay tuned for details.
· Sunday, July 19th -- Graduation at 7 pm in the BHS Accusport Stadium
Dr. Noeth will send a school messenger with the updates today or tomorrow.

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-color: initial; text-align: inherit; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

p.span: Paper pick up and drop off locations and times will remain the same. They are:

p.span: Paper copies of student work will available on the following schedule only:

p.span: BHS – Cafeteria

span.style: font-size: 12pt; background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; font-family: "Times New Roman", serif;

p.span: Today, the district donated commercial sanitizing supplies to the local Emergency Management Agency. Those were supplies that the custodians would have been used on a daily basis if we would have had students in the schools. In the event that might return to the buildings this school year, we have not donated all of our sanitizing supplies.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; line-height: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
p.span: According to the district calendar, the district is closed tomorrow for Good Friday and on Monday for an extended Easter Weekend. New lessons for next week will post on Tuesday.

p.style: background-image: initial; background-position: initial; background-size: initial; background-repeat: initial; background-attachment: initial; background-origin: initial; background-clip: initial; margin-bottom: 0.0001pt; line-height: normal; vertical-align: baseline;
p.span: If you have had no contact to date, please check email or call the school office on Tuesday.​

div.div: June 8th-12th, 2020 9:30 a.m. – 11:30 a.m. Bellefontaine High School 555 East Lake Avenue Bellefontaine, Ohio 43311 Summer Enrichment Academy is designed to provide academic and creative challenges for gifted or highly motivated students entering second (2nd) grade through eighth (8th) grade (in the fall of 2020). READ MORE...

Children who will be five years old on or before August 1, 2020 are eligible to attend kindergarten during the 2020-2021 school year. Parents are encouraged to register an eligible child by calling Bellefontaine Elementary at 599-4331 before March 20, 2020. Registration notices are being sent home with elementary school children and with children attending local pre-school programs. Additional notices are available at each school. READ MORE...

Children can be especially susceptible to the dangers associated with winter weather. Their youthful enthusiasm often takes over when common sense and safety should prevail. We encourage all our families and students to stay inform of winter weather and school closing by listening to daily reports on local radio, television, our district call systems and website. READ MORE...

Nominations are currently being accepted for the Bellefontaine High School 2020 Distinguished Alumni Award. This award has been established to honor alumni whose actions and achievements bring honor and distinction to the academic heritage of Bellefontaine High School. READ MORE...

Registration for all students in grades K-12 is done at our elementary school office. The office is located at: Bellefontaine Elementary School 1001 Ludlow Road Bellefontaine, Ohio, 43311 Phone: (937) 599-4331 Fax: (937) 599-3362 Please ask for elementary secretary, Pam Patton. READ MORE...

These immunizations are required for school attendance by law under the Ohio Revised Code section 3313.67 and 3313.671. Your family physician, local pharmacy, or the Logan County Health District can complete these immunizations. READ MORE...
Logan County will begin offering the Dolly Parton Imagination Library to all families with children age birth to five starting January of 2017. READ MORE...
